Visuals/graphics: 7 out of 10 (meh) Audio/music: 9 out of 10 (got my heart pounding for many scenes) Gameplay: 7.5 out of 10. (Lots of bad and good. Repetitive but great in small doses) Plot: 3 out of 10. (I understand this is a Tomb Raider game, but they didn't need to throw in every literary trope) Characterization: 4 out of 10 (Except for Laura, the characters are pretty cringe-worthy) Level of faithfulness to the original: 9 out of 10 (pretty solid with a few new twists)  Overall: 8 out of 10

As the game description says, this game takes you along Lara’s journey from a naïve history buff to a hardened, BA rogue. The story is quite good but could have been drawn out a bit more to make the evolution seem smoother. At a few times the game can be a bit challenging if you’re struggling with trying to do something and that it is unfortunately programed to not let you do (or do it differently). It’s too bad that QTEs are still in games today; however, this game utilizes actions in normal gameplay as QTEs and vice versa to the point that they become innate. Overall, a great game by a relatively new studio, defiantly worth full price, and I look forward to playing again through in order to unlock everything and find every item.
A Fun game with great graphics and sounds. The story is great and is darker then the previous games. The control for keyboard and mouse where no problems.

Great game. The begining is slow and off puttting. instant action from the very begining and you aren't sure what exactly is going on. You begin to gain peices as you go on which really helps buid Lara's character. Gamplay is a little like Uncharted but I, personally, feel like its unique enough to make it its own. Survival sense is easy to abuse and comes directly from Hitman Absolution... why they added this 'cheat' in both games, I'll never know. Overall, amazing reboot and awesome to play a powerful female protaganist.  Begining (story wise) -- 7/10 By the end -- a solid 9/10

I thought this game was really fantastic. It doesn't introduce a whole lot of fresh ideas, but manages to be very frun from one moment to the next, with enough distractions in between to make the world feel open without being overwhelming. The gmaeplay is very reminiscent of the Uncharted series--bombastic scripted action sequences, linear platforming, the occasional environmental puzzle, and cover-based combat. Two things I really appreciated on the combat side was to cover system, which is entirely contextual, and the melee, which introduced a lot of different kinds of moves and dynamic finishers. Rather than dodging, Lara scrambles out of the way, which ties in well with the theme of 'leaning to survive by any means necesary' that pervades the narrative.  While much of what happens to Lara can be brutal and ugly, the graphics are absolutely gorgeous. Hands-down, with the settings turned up, this is the best-looking PC game I've played. That said, my water-cooled GTX 780 was really chugging during the most demanding parts. But, Lord, was it worth it. So much pretty.  The sound design and music were all great, too, and highlighted the intense action sequences very well. Overall, I felt like the story was tight and focused without quite being as much of an interactive movie as, say, Max Payne. The combat arenas tend to have just enough variety to make me feel like I'm making decisions.  As usual, I didn't try the multiplayer, so I can't speak to its quality.  For the completionists out there, the collectibles are pretty cool and there are lots of different types. Most have story-based components, and a lot can be picked up throughout the main quest. I got almost 100% with the exception of one combat-related achievement that relies on attacking an enemy at exactly the right time and also depends on the placement of other enemies. So, that one was annoying. Naturally, I have no insights into the multiplayer achievements.  A fine, fine first foray for the new Lara Croft. I look forward to the next. Between this and Sleeping Dogs, I've been quite impressed with Square Enix as of late. Then again, they're still making Final Fantasy titles, right?

Don't have much time to write an in-depth review, but if you're looking for a game with amazing graphical fidelity, and a story that makes you not want to stop playing and actually legitimately hoooks you in, buy this. I'm not a big story person. Usually when i buy a game it's not for the story, it's either because it looks fun and/or it has awesome mechanics. This game really hooked me in though. I started playing it and i thought 'huh, this game is pretty cool'. One weekend of straight playing later, i was almost in tears at the end. The story actually got me so attached i didn't want it to end and was almost in tears. I had to punch a wall to feel like a man again. Recommended it to all my friends, the one who bought it loved it and said it was fantastic. If you have the hardware to support it, definately play this on full graphics settings. It helps a lot and really adds to the atmosphere. This was one of my favorite games of all time, and that's saying something since i've been gaming since I was 4-5, and i've seen quite a lot of games in my time.

This game should've sold 5 million copies on PC alone, especially with all the awesome STEAM sales it had! I don't know the exact figures but I know the developers are not very happy it never sold what they expected (not even breaking 3 million copies between all the platforms). The PC version looks as good if not better than the 'next gen' versions that are just coming out... and we've had these awesome gfx since day ONE... I really hope they continue with this series reboot and we see a sequel to this spectacuar game. Lucky are the ones who picked this title up for a mere 10 bucks because the game was easily worth the original $50.00 price tag. Being a PC gamer I was very happy for all the work they put into the PC port and you could really see they cared about the PC fanbase... I certainly got my fingers crossed for another installment ON PC of course and I hope it is a smashing success as it deserves to be.
Great Game!  Replay value is very high!
Really enjoying this game. Looks good plays well.
Where most modern action games fail is in the pacing, and it's something that this game absolutely gets right. Surprisingly good, though the last twenty minutes or so left a bad taste in my mouth.

Tomb Raider (2013) is really good. I put off playing it for the longest time because I was afraid it wouldn't live up to the hype, but I think it does. I've heard it compared to Uncharted, but I haven't played those so I can't really say if that's true. Basically the game is Prince of Persia with guns, with Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater's survivalist feel and general setting, mixed with a little metroidvania. I've never played a Tomb Raider game before so I don't know how it compares to the other games in the series. Graphics are some of the best I've seen, even though I could only run it on Ultra and not Maximum (the hair physics killed my framerate on my GTX 550ti). I paid $10 bucks for it, took 9 hours to finish (did some but not all of the side quests).
One of the best games 2013. Incredibly fun and excellent controls. Never a boring moment.

From start to finish, this game plays like a high end action flick. It has a riveting story, great action and combat, and you can really feel the tension in Lara's strugle. I haven't even touched the multiplayer yet, and this is one of the best games I've played in the last few years. I didn't even like the other Tomb Raider games.

By far one of my favorite games of 2013. That is a lot considering that I was not a big TR fan. I played the first TR back in the day and some of the later ones but never got into TR. The story was interesting enough to make me get attached to Lara and her adventure. This tells the story of how Lara became the Lara we know. She is not just born a bad ♥♥♥ she starts off weak and vulnerable then grows into that...  Don't want to give too much away so I'll leave it at that. I can't wait fot the sequel.
Great game. The add-on was a bit of a let down, but the game was worth it!
Awesome game! Would reccomend this to anyone
Its a good game to binge on if you have time.

This is a solid game. Decent puzzles, fairly good ranged combat, and a good overall pacing, including the rate at which you acquire/upgrade your gear. The game is beautiful and the world is really well crafted, pretty big, but completely managable to traverse.  The story is okay, but you kill so many people so efficiently that Lara's disbelief at what she is doing wears thin a little quickly. The first kill is believably world-changing for her, but after that you pickoff bad guys as though she does this every day, with not a lot of remorse or reflection being meaningfully shown. I found that the best bits of the story are, interestingly enough, in the optional collectibles. You get a good sense of the crazy nature of the island from picking up journals and, to a lesser extent, the artifacts.  The game's biggest problem for me was its overreliance on quick time events. Get in close with an enemy? QTE. Hit a ledge after a long jump? QTE. Finish a boss? QTE. Any game that regularly instructs you to 'mash F to ____' should take a step back and reconsider some mechanics.   All in all though, a thoroughly enjoyable game and a great pick up off the Holiday Sale.

I was never into Tomb Raider, but it has a reputation that began to go down hill later in the franchise. I don't have much to judge it on, but I highly enjoyed this one. It is very well polished and suitable for new comers taking us back to the start.
Really much better than I expected. If you love Uncharted defintely play this!

First off one of my favorite game series is Uncharted, and this game gave it a good run (they are similar). Not quite as good, but still one of the better games of this type that are rarely available on a PC. Graphics are great, story is good, control is good, and replay value is there if you want to find all the goodies. This is a great reboot for Tomb Raider, and look forward to part 2. I plan on purchasing the follow up when it comes out.   Mostly used mouse and keyboard controls, but tried the Xbox 360 (and it worked well) one as well, and was surprised that I could go back and forth on the fly, and it also showed the keys accordingly.   Even if you didn't like the original TR games, this one is different and should not be compared. I highly recommend this game.
I loved the original TR 1 back in 1996 / 1997 .. that was a great and revolutianory game .... This new reboot is also great . !
A much needed reboot of the series. Very refreshing and compelling game.
Very fun and addicting.
One of the best games I've ever played, taking the Tomb Raider series to a whole new level - hell, a whole new level of new levels. Phenomenal. Can't wait for the sequel!

A really great game, surely deserves to be called Game of the Year. Took me way to long to play it - if only I knew what I was missing...  The game has a linear story where you play as a very human and beliavable (yet badass) Lara Croft. As the plot goes on you'll explore large and well developed areas. You may choose to move directly to your goal or explore around in search of relics, documents (to achieve 100% - it's not necessary, but it's fun and ads to the story) and junk that can be used to upgrade your equipment. The art is excellent, the mechanics are simple and yet varied enough not to be repetitive and you can choose between different weapons and outfits (the former are cosmetic only, though).  A fun action game with a interesting story and deep characters. By far the best Tomb Raider game I have ever played. I hope they continue on this path for the rest of the franchise games yet to come.
Fantastic Comeback!

Overall it is a nice Tomb Raider, not without flaws, but it very beautiful and technically impressive (very beautiful scenes with details where needed and very fluid). Great story, nice soundtrack, long enough storyline, despite the lack of surprises. Lots of exploring and wide, beautiful scenery. Lacks the amount of mystic the original ones had, but still interesting.

What an amazing game! I was really sad that it was so short (25 hours to 100% everything in single-player), but it was worth more than the $5 I paid for the game on sale.  I don't much like multiplayer/PvP gameplay, so I'm not going to be able to experience all of Tomb Raider. I think that they were including the play-time that multiplayer would have provided to players when setting a value for the game.
Amazing, I loved the early games and this one is a great origen story
Buy.This.GAME!
Good game, but not a 'real' tomb raider. Took about three days to complete it to 100%, so a bit on the short side.

This game was brilliant, it had emotion, action, mystery, etc... The graphics are great and its a great storyline, if there is one thing that I had to say that I didnt like about this game is that you have to spend a lot of time to collect lots of relics and journels, etc... but apart from that great 9/10

The first 30min was frustrating. I felt like i was on a rail shooter, but once the world opened up -- wow! I was blown away. This game was absolutely fabulous. The story line is great, though I wish they could've developed some of the other characters a bit. Once the game opened up, I was completely immersed in getting 100% completion. The combat mechanics were fluid and the way that Lara automatically reacts to surroundings when needed was fantastic. The graphics and artwork were great and I felt they created the perfect mood when moving through each area.  There are a few Quick Time Events that get annoying... they were a bit unclear as to when to strike the key. (Wait til the larger circle shrinks into the smaller one... then mash the button they tell you to!) Also the 'mash this button to pry open...' got annoying. I don't often button mash with my left hand so I found myself taking my right hand off the mouse in order to mash the E button.   All in All i'd say this game is a great balance between Assassin's Creed, Batman, and Uncharted. I was totally invested in Lara and i am still sad the game is over. I hope they continue this storyline and I look forward to the next installment...   [8 out of 10 do to some minor game mechanics, but amazing gameplay.]
If you ever wanted to play Uncharted on the PC this is as close as you're gonna get !

The 'reboot, but grittier' approach definitely worked for this game. I finished the story with 100% optional completion, on easy difficulty level, in 23 hours, and it was well worth the ride. The puzzles aren't super difficult, but manage to be interesting and in some cases nerve-wracking. The story itself is pretty good as well, and I would definitely recommend this if you're into this 3rd person shooter/platform puzzler game. I'm quite looking forward to seeing what they will do for the sequel.

Suprisingly strong game. I wasn't anticipating much based on the back catalogue of the franchise, but this 'reboot' of the character and story is certainly worth your time.  The characters are believable, well voice acted, excellently animated and the main story arc is gripping - especially in the second half, where most games usually lose the plot. It does drift a little into the supernatural in the finale however but it's built up well and it doesn't feel out of place in an otherwise semi-realistic game.  Unlike the mushy controls and infuriating 'have to be in the designers head' jump puzzles of the previous games, this entry never left me feeling out of control and I could always figure out the various chambers without feeling like it was too opaque or too signposted.  Combat is fluid yet simplistic. And there is a comfortable difficulty curve that matches new opponent abilities with upgrades and new items for your arsenal.  Great pacing. Superb production values. Pleasantly surprised.
Really intense game! Fun.

Although the game is plentiful with problems (e.g. too easy, hand-holding, QTE's, cliche story, etc.), it succeeds in giving you satisfying adventure game that breaths life into the Tomb Raider franchise. The combat is fun, visual fidelity is off-the-charts, and it truly feels like YOU are Lara Croft, and YOU are on the journey. Easily recommended, especially if your GPU can take full advantage of the games visual flare, it looks gorgeous on maximum settings!

*Gnome Seal of Approval* The Tomb Raider series takes a different turn with this game. So much, in fact, that it's not really a real Tomb Raider game. Only in name. The focus have shifted from platforming and puzzle solving to straight up action. A decision I don't personally agree with.  The game is packed full of quick time events and cutscenes. The annoying and flat characters don't help either. But once you get past all that and get into the action, there's a really good game here. Guns feel great. Movement and animation is fluid.  Recommended for fans of third person shooters. Not recommended if you want the puzzle solving and platforming Tomb Raider is known for.

Pretty much what I wanted Uncharted to be: actual platforming and exploration. The tool discovery and upgrades are very similar to what's found in The Last of Us and means there's constantly new areas to explore previously visited locations. It also doesn't fall into the pitfalls Uncharted of having too much combat focus (it nearly does during the shanty town section but thankfully stops right after).  Now give me my Pillar of the Community badge.

Great game with a nice story. A worthy title of the tomb raider brand. I had a lot fo fun completing it and collectors will be in hog heaven as you can find tons of stuff to collect on the island.   Works great with the XBOX wireless gamecontroller.

Combine the stealth mechanics from Assassin's Creed, the puzzles of Zelda, and the combat of Far Cry and you have yourself a wonderful retake on the classic Tomb Raider series. Every moment of the story was suspensful, the characters dynamic and real, and danger very real. I would 10/10 recommend this game to anybody wanting to know more about this exceptional new adventure series.
Very good game! It is very nice restart of saga about Lara.
This is the best game in the series. If you ever enjoyed Tomb Raider, you should play this.

If you enjoy playing Adventure games you will enjoy this Tom Raider, for me is the best in the series, totally worth your money and time.  The additions made to the game in the form or weapon improvement and skills are welcome to the formula.  Buy it now! must be in your collection, I had zero issues with the game but lots of fun.

This is one pretty awesome game to add to the Tomb Raider franchise. I love how the story line is now a big part of the game unlike the previous games where it was just running through the environment with no idea what to do. All you knew was to kill anything that ran in your direction. A lot of people I know have come out saying the game is crap. How it doesn't follow the old games. Things like how you hunt a deer for food in the beginning of the game yet you never have to look for food again. But lets face it... Gamers hate change in games from the old days and gamers lover to nag and complain about idiotic things. Sure you only hunt once and you complain about that. But if you had to constantly hunt for food, these same people would complain about how they spend all their time looking for food and never seem to get to the action parts. People need to learn to stop comparing games to their past titles and look to the future of gaming. Judge each game as unique in it's own right. You can't want a game to stay the same forever and want it to change as well.  All in all an excellent game. I loved it!
Great take a classic franchise. From the first kill to your last tomb you feel for Laura throughout the game whilst you watch her grow into the Tomb Raider we know and love
They've done a pretty good job with this Tomb Raider - the puzzles are a little on the easy side but overall I was very entertained by it.
Very nice game unfortunately it is mostly designed to be played with pad (quick time sensitive button mashing).
This game is just beautiful. Successfull reboot for the franchise. The team @ Crystal Dynamic had done a wonderful job out there. No need for multiplayer anyway..
Worth it !
Aside from wishing it was longer (as I don't care about Multiplayer), it's a fantastic reboot. I can't wait to see what comes next.

Was never a fan of the original series. This reboot turned it into a survival and scavenging game which makes it amazing. The endgame or extra content besides the main story seems a bit too easy but still keeps you very entertained. Definite need to play game.

One of the most enjoyable and fluid combat systems out there. Only problem with the game is that it's easily 100% in 15-20 hours and doesn't have that much replay value. Even with the combat being really good. There's just barely any enemies to fight or shenanigans to be had after you 100% it. I just wish they'd have gone for more options endgame in it. Some spoilers I can't reveal, but the enemies you face close to the end of the game is some of the coolest enemies I've ever had the enjoyment of fighting against. As shortlived as those fight sequences are at the whole scope of the game. It certainly could've been a gaming classic if only it had more replay value, endgame and just, more fun stuff to do. Because everything is fantastic until it's all done and over.  Still. Really good game. Exploration and combat is really fun. It's a more casual Dishonored to me. Which is a game that has endless replay value and even better combat to pretty much perfection of that genre. But Tomb Raider is still a fantastic game and will definitely surprise you if you didn't expect anything going into it.

I bought this game out of complete boredom, but it turned out to be one of the best I've ever played. With an open world full of challenges and upgrades for your gear, it hooked me from the start. I couldn't stop playing until I had to take a break or go somewhere. You really get close to the main character as well, following her from the start. I haven't tried out the multiplayer yet, but it seems like it will be interesting based on the guns and environment in the game. Get it while it's 75% off!
If you haven't played this reboot it really is worth it. If you can catch it on sale it is even better. 9/10

Actually pretty great. Even if the actual raiding of tombs is more a sidequest, the island is a spooky place that is legitimately spooky, the gunplay works, and they somehow make the supernatural elements blend with the new direction. Maybe don't pay full price for it, but hey. It's neat.  Also don't bother with the hair effect thing, it adds nothing and murders your graphics card.

Probably one of the best games I have played in a while. You get to see your character progress into a 'survivor'. You can approach many scenarios any way you choose. Very similar to Uncharted for the ps3 ( with a much better story). This game can be very brutal. If you die you will see your character impaled, ripped to death and eaten by others.

Yes! I've completed the game and highly recommend Tomb Raider. It's more than just exploring tombs, there's a great story and characters behind this game. Also beautiful graphics and great level design.
Nice graphic and a really good story!
After the first hour of mostly QTE ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t this game rules.

It's a solid game. It's worth a go.  It's a psuedo-linear game with branching exploratory areas. The mechanics and environments are solid. I think the enemy AI could use some work. It's feels to be a clone of Naughty Dog's Uncharted Series. Irony is that Tomb Raider was the first one to do the archeology supernatural type of action game but was perfected by Naughty Dog.  Tomb Raider has got it's own fine points though I wish it would return to it's roots with some of the acrobatics involved. Just have to wait and see.  If you have some time for an actioni Indian Jones game then this is a good game to spend some time with.
This was one of the best games I have played in a long, long time. I would highly reccomend!

I bought Tomb Raider when it was on sale, not knowing exactly what I would be getting into. Considering the series has had many pitfalls (pun not intended) in the past, I was more curious to see what this would have to offer. Wow. The first impression was that the graphics are amazing. The second is that I have to do button sequences properly or I die. The third was the immense puzzles and intricate world that I found myself in. The depths of a jungle, with wild wolves circling me for dinner. Ruined castles and frigid mountain tops to explore and survive the dangers of. This reimagining of Lara Crofts adventures was not only sorely needed, but brilliantly executed. Just like the headshots you can kill enemies with.  Find and upgrade weapons, loot animals for exp, use the environment to take our enemies. They're all familiar mechanics in a platformer survival game, but this game is amazing, and I'm genuinely glad I purchased it.
Not Bad
Finally a good tomb raider game for all ttose old school lovers. Really shows how Laura develops as a person
Beautiful visuals, and great story, fun game!
This game is a deffo must have its amazing

-'Lara begins' a new take on the legend-  I've never been a huge fan of the original series being so camp and buggy. The breasty heroine with the pistols appealing to teenage boys, clipping errors, endless searches for a ledge or switch... Ok the later you'll have here too but not that much. This game is more dark and mature featuring a young frightened Lara drenched in blood learning to kill to survive. Still you have the running, jumping, shooting, climbing ledges in fluid animations. Areas connect almost linear but you can come back for collectibles.  Features: The awesome graphics will immerse you in the game for example when you climb a radio tower. When young Lara gets penetrated by an iron spike you automatically flinch. (game is a bloodbath) I took screenshots all the time - nice wallpapers. Usually I'm not a graphic-mad gamer but here it's the main selling point beside some really satisfying combat and mildly difficult puzzles. A hint of RPG with some perks to unlock on level up.  Recommended for fans of action-adventure gameplay (Tomb Raider series, Prince of Persia) -climbing and shooting. Beware there's no replay value here except higher difficulty so wait for a sale. Also own a good PC.

A worthy reboot. A wide variety of game mechanics, including surprisingly in depth melee, presented in a way that is familiar but not boring. If you have the machine to max the specs this is also one of the best looking games currently available.

Entertaining adventure of Lara Croft in refurbished edition. I have been able to complete game in 100% and it was truly amazing. New approach to the series turned out to be right on target. It should be noted that Tomb Raider does not have as high system requirements as it may seem. With TressFX disabled the game runs smoothly on ultra (GeForce GTX 660).

This game is the Tomb Raider themed entry to the Uncharted franchise. I mean that as a compliment. Some good action, some mostly-hand-held puzzles, lots of 'secrets' to discover, some amazing and horrifying environments and overall perfect controls. If you like over the shoulder adventures, you'll love this game, no prior Tomb Raider experience needed.
Most enjoyable game in this decade and give me a feeling that another game doesn't even give in a long time since i play games. And if there are another sequel like 'this' why not.

One of the best games                  

The new Tomb Raider is an awesome game with good story, characters, and graphics a must buy specialy if you are a Tomb Raider fan.  Oh and Camilla Luddington is perfect as Tomb Raider! if thy ever gonna make a live action movie pick her! she is the new Tomb Raider!
The rebirth for Lara Croft in all her glory. Excellent game!
Not much to say that hasn't already been said. Nice plot, decent gameplay, and top-notch graphics! It was a steal for $10, so even at half-price durring the holiday sale, I'd say it's worth it!

It's a great game the story line is amazing but very very short. For me the game was almost completely ruined by the fact it is mostly taken up by mulitiplayer style very much like COD. If that is your thing then you will like it since it have a leveling system and different characters you can play, but for me being a long time Tomb Raider fan this new development in this frachise dissapointed me.
incredible game, great blend of story and action and puzzles

Very good gritty take on the genre. This game will make you cringe and wince often at the things that happen to Lara throughout. Has some of the most fun platforming and puzzles I've seen in a long time. If you've been on the fence about picking this up I say pull the trigger! You won't be disappointed :)

As a reboot of the game I was around for back in the '90s, this is quite a successful one.  The mechanics to play are solid (very Sands Of Time), the story is quite good (although slightly predictable), the art, music and acting solid as well, and this game is DEFINITELY worth a purchase AND a sequel.  My only wish for the sequel? LESS Q.T.Es. They were overused. A LOT. The rest is great though! (An Aussie crewmember would be awesome too.)  SPOILER BELOW:  I ♥♥♥♥♥ about Q.T.Es because it's so overused the last battle is just Q.T.Es!!! No joke! What is this? A Quantic Dream game?!
Tomb Raider is one of the best games of the year. Beautiful graphics, nice little RPG elements, and a little platforming too. Story is pretty compelling too. i Highly recommend this game.
Game of the year 2013. Great gameplay, story and many hours singeplayer.
Errily like Uncharted, but still a sweet game..imitation is best form of flatytery right? Great reboot of game 8/10 IMHO

I have never played any Tomb Raider game before but since I began with this one, I'd surely in the near future check the others from this series out!! Great gameplay, without question the best storyline I've ever experienced from the adventure/action genre. Even if the name Tomb Raider or Lara Croft is new to you,   BUY IT  , you won't regret it!

Very exciting. I was looking for something to replace my love for Uncharted after making the switch to PC, and Tomb Raider absolutely satisfied in that regard.  The action is superb, and the platforming is exciting, but easy.  Keep in mind that once Lara starts killing, it get's very OTT very quickly, but it IS a third person action adventure. The first kill is extremely powerful and emotional, which makes her transition to a vengeful action hero a little... fast. It didn't bother me, but I can see how some people had gripes.  Upgrading the weapons is very satisfying. And they even have tombs that you can raid!
A worthy successor of the series + with some extra flavour :)
Gripping storyline with stunning direction

An amazing game that lived up to the hype and then some.   First off I did play the original tomb raider on console years ago and never finished it. I found the puzzles to be frustratingly vauge/hard and the story never really hooked me.   This on the other hand had me hooked from the get go. This most certainly a mature title due to the store and the blood and gore. While she may be an archeologist for the majority of the game Laura is fighting for her life and scrambling to get buy. There are some very challenging battles, but none of them feel unfair. There are a few quick time events, however they are done better than most and don't detract in most cases. The story and voice acting is excellent though a few of the characters are a bit predictable.   You still have tombs to discover and explore and the jumping/climbing mechanics work very well. The gun play is excellent with a nice selection of weapons and a good upgrade system that rewards you for exploring the island.   Overall I would highly recommend this especially if you can catch it on sale.

Really solid effort in rebooting the series. The graphics and gameplay are simple enough, but plentiful enough to offer a rich experience. Music and sound effects are top notch and the weapons and skill levelling is indepth and drives you forward to get that next level. Voice acting was a bit mediocre, with Lara's accent drifting a little Americanised here and there, but not big enough of an issue to detract from the game. The storyline was okay - a bit on the predictable side, but it was well executed and gave a natural fluidity to game progression. The character development is fantastic - you can see Lara change from a scared, freshfaced adventurer to a toughened and no-nonsense tomb raider we know.

A nice addition to the Tomb Raider series. I haven't played many of them, but the ones I have, this feels a giant step up from. While it's still about solving puzzles, the Lara here is different. Here you have a character who seems weak and scared (and what not), not this lady who can get through anything like previous.  It feel almost more realistic. Also, the environments are amazing, combat is a little on the easy side, and the collectables are desirerable to get, to learn a little something (I feel they are based on real facts). Over all this was a very fun game, and I can't wait for a sequal. Square Enix did a very good job with this game, and I'd advise everyone to get it

Prepare yourself a new, realistic and brutal Lara Croft!  Beautiful graphics, intense gameplay and interesting story, lots of exploring and suprisingly lot violence. The best Tomb Raider game so far, highly recommended!
Very great game, and looks AMAZING! The crafting system is weird, but I got used to it fairly quick. Overall I've very happy with this game!
Exciting action packed advanture! Well worth the time
definately a buy
Very good platforming mixed with crisp combat. Nice collection and easter egg system. Could have been a bit more difficult to 100% the game.
Gamplay and graphics are amazing!

I enjoyed this game a lot. I am currently playing through trying to get a 100% completion. The eye candy(graphics) in this game really make it enjoyable, in my opinion. The story of Laura starting out as a sweet doe eyed woman then going through this adventure and hardening up was a treat. I look forward to the sequal when it comes out.
Immersive... Not exactly what you expect in a Tamb Raider game. But as an action adventure game, it is truly remarkable and should not be missed.
This is the reboot the franchise needed. By showing Lara's evolution from an archaeology student into a fully fledged badass, the new Tomb Raider game is close to perfect.
awesome reboot of a classic a real imersive and action pack game. one for the ages

As a Lara Croft murder simultor you can't go past Tomb Raider. Lara can die in thousands of ways with lovely cinematic deaths in quicktime events. I've killed Lara over 100 times and I haven't even got far enough to get a gun yet. Realistic hair physics thanks to my AMD card, means her hair looks great while being impaled, crushed, mauled or falling to her doom. Top class voice acting when life is escaping from her body. Highly recommend if you like killing things (Lara is a thing).
you can shoot deer for no reason and make guns out of garbage and also if you press buttons really fast you won't die
ABSOLUTELY FECKIN INCREDIBLE! BUY IT NOW
DO NOT BUY IF YOUVE GOT AN NVIDIA GRAPHICS 600 SERIES CARD IT CRASHES ALL THE TIME!!!!!!!!!
Fantastic gameplay with a great story. Loved it

Where to start, i love this game so much, Although ths game is not like any other of the tomb raiders it is very like Uncharted which is a game i love. You may find it hard to find online matches as i do but the single player its self is very fun and i am only at 36% completed and i have played the story for at least 5 hours. If you like a long story where u can find hidden things and like shooting and puzzle games this is the game for you. The only negative thing about this game is that it has less puzzle than it does in the other games but still i would definatly reccomend it. Now i have the game i would pay £15 the highest  8.5/10

A WORTHY ENTRY!  Crystal Dynamics have brilliantly brought Lara Croft into the new generation! With an interesting story about the misterious island its up to Lara to discover what secretes the island holds to find a way to escape with her fellow travellers after a ship wreak. You are ment to feel sorry for Lara and sometimes feel helpless to help her but you carry on to keep her safe and it reall does show and work in this game!   Lara comes off as the sweet, inoccent girl who is just starting out her tomb raiding career, but over the course of the game she transforms into the Lara we know from her earliy days. This sounds like a great premiss but its not exacuted well. You may have heard of the infamous scene in an early trailer where she was nearly ♥♥♥♥♥, THAT MOMENT is the turning point of her character. She has killed a person for the first time, does she get time to reflect and question her decison? NOPE! Seconds later she is killing ton of other bad guys and she never reflexs on it again. After that, the only character development we get is; she has tombs to exploer. Yes we see her grow stronger and more dependant but the turning point happens too quickly.  As lara is stranded on an island her only tools are items she finds around the island to craft to make bows, spares etc, as well as guns left by previous enhabitants. Great machanic, but I only found myself using it once to make the bow and arrow that is nesersery. Other than that, your guns and bow and and arrow will get you through and there is no real need to want to craft more items.  Multiplayer... its there....  Other than the lack luster multiplayer and the tombs to exploer, there is no real reason to come back to want to play this game unless you are a completionist. I finished the story and loved it! Want more... tried multiplayer once... never player the game since.  CONSCLUSTION Story 7/10 Graphics 9/10 Gameplay 7/10 Multiplayer 5/10 Replayabilty 4/10  Many people say that Uncharted copied from Tomb Raider and this reboot copied from Uncharted, but is that nesserly a bad thing? It's a great reboot and I can't wait to see where the future instalments leads us!  7.5/10
Pure awesomeness! a must have better than Tomb Raider : Underworld! :D If you don't have it yet than get it now!!! ;)
This was the very first video game I played through to the end, and I LOVED it! I found it extremely immersive and especially liked the exploration aspect.

Hot ♥♥♥♥♥ breast reduction nice ♥♥♥ tho Ill take it I was going to spoil the plot but I forgot it Does this game even have a plot Feelteamsix.jpg Blackhawkdown 10/10 GOTY  Oh yeah you kill your own crew at the end
Amazing. Graphics, gameplay, voice-acting, soundtrack. Absolutely amazing.

Do not buy this game, unless you like being guided all the time, love easiest tombs ever(whole 7/8 of them), and love 'cinematic experience'. This game is pure ♥♥♥♥, has 0 gameplay, boring story and bland characters. DO NOT RECOMMEND, DO NOT BUY, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY AND TIME. 0/10, Square enix can go ♥♥♥♥ themselves.
dat ♥♥♥ tho
Great game!! The story develops like a movie. Action, adventure, drama and thriller. Everything together with a simple gameplay. Some puzzles to break the tension.

Tomb Raider has gorgeous set-pieces, action-packed third person gameplay, and very good controls (played with gamepad). It's the Uncharted for all non-Playstation-gamers.  The free-climbing felt better and more precise than Assassin's Creed. It has more open environments than Uncharted. The only minor flaws in my opinion is the unreasonable shaky camera in some cutscenes (during gameplay the camera is always spot on and very well positioned).  The skill and upgrade-system seems interesting at first but since you easily unlock everything by the end it seems kinda pointless.  The story starts out well and promising. Lara Croft is likeable and excellent cutscenes are showing her as a growing personality that is struggling with her situation. Unfortunately the game itself turns these cutscenes ad absurdum when you are a walking killing-machine that recovers health constantly. The overall plot is interesting and I enjoyed listening to all sidenotes and journals, but it is too predictable and doesn't offer any surprises. The voice-acting is excellent for every character as well.  All in all it is a highly enjoyable game and probably one of the best titles this year. Definitely worth more than the 10$ sale price.  Sidenote: Multiplayer seems dead for this game. Too bad.
I was pretty pleased with this game, played it though and it had fun pretty much the whole time.
It's decent, that's all I can say

Probably my favorite game of the year. Fantastic pacing that keeps you interested the entire time. Zone collectibles aren't ridiculously hidden all the time and it's actually not too bad to get them without a walkthrough. Beyond, beyond, beyond BEAUTIFUL. Buy, buy, buy!

I'm a PC gamer only, and i've been around for all the TR iterations. I had as much fun and discovery in this game as I did playing the first in the series. The eye-candy is superb, but it still takes second place to the gameplay. Sweet, sweet, fun.
Tomb Raider is a very fine reboot indeed. Love the art style, love the story. One of the few games I played from start to finish in one go.

I think the best way to sum up this game is *FINALLY AN AWESOME TOMB RAIDER GAME*!!!!! If you are a huge fan of the Uncharted franchise like me, you will definitely enjoy this game. Don't think the two games are the same eventhough they are similar. Did I forget to mention the graphics of this game is amazing?!!!!!!
More violence and blood, especially for a game with a T rating for it's entire life, is not the best. Great game, but a definate departure from, well, everything. Still fun.

Tomb Raider (2013) is one of the most immersive, beautiful and truly enjoyable games in 2013. The character development is solid. The story sequences are engaging and exciting. The voice acting, sound effects and soundtracks are incredible. Crystal Dynamics did a magnificent job in making this game. IMHO this game deserves 'Game of The Year 2013' title. I highly recommend that you should buy a copy if you have not done so.
A good mix of climbing and shooting action makes Tomb Raider a very solid reboot. It also looks stunning if you crank up the graphics to maximum settings.
i really enjoy playing this game !
Fast game if you don't go through the side missions. About 9 hours into the story and you're just about done. Great game overall.
stunning graphics, well set story line that kept me intwined right to the end. definately a must play. cant wait for another.
Excellent reboot of already very successful franchise! Very fun game and I would recommend it to everyone :)
'Tomb Raider' might sound outdated. But this reboot is really awesome.  Get this, get this, get this!

I enjoyed this more open world adventure Tomb Raider alot it was a dark gritty weaved story and I think it had a good origin and very immersive story to Lara. She seems more like a real person in this and now we know how she became such a bad ♥♥♥ archaeologist. Id love to have seen the developers have weaved some type of multi player co op story into it because I do not connect Tomb Raider with PVP team/deathmatch games at all. The bad things I stumpled across was the way to short tombs you find. Wished there had been alot more to them and the puzzles was way to easy. Also wished there would have been reasons to play it after the end besides finding achievements. But all in all I liked the new tomb raider alot and would definitly recommend others to try it if they like that kind of game.
Great game! Was unable to stop playing.
Multiplayer is pretty bland due to over complicated buttons but the singleplayer is really good and not over quickly. Recommend!

Good game, but very similar to several other games out there. If I was to pick one thing it was too much FPS versus puzzle solving. All of the tombs and climbing puzzles only have one solution, and Assassin's Creed does this much better. Funny that AC got the formula from the original Tomb Raider games.
one of the best games in 2013 , hopefully the story continues ! :)

Even if you get this game cheap, which I did not(bought on release), it's still not worth wading through the endless quick time events to see if any part of this game is enjoyable. Good graphics, with predictable set pieces for the first few hours, riddled with quick time events for no other reason than to have something to press. Awful design decision ruining an otherwise decent looking and feeling game.
Very nice game though it's very graphics intensive so get a good card if you want a good experience.
best tomb raider game of the series and one of the best games of 2013.
Love it! Wonderfully engaging storyline, looks beautiful, mechanics great, and tonnes of collectibles and extras for when you've completed the main storyline.

Tomb Raider.  I have not played very much of this game but I really do enjoying the whole being in the forest at the moment with a bow and my gun.  Killing things to survive sneaking around and using your bow to take out the enemy feels fantastic, pulling on that string knowing you are about to release and freak out your enemy.  The gameplay is pretty decent it feels like Tomb Raider that aspect of the game has not died.  I also really like what they have done with Lara shes still y'know the same Lara we've always known but this time we're going way back to before she was fully exploring or atleast went into trouble whilst exploring. Major things happen in the first 20 minutes of playing the game and you really see the character develope. Over a few short minutes of gameplay and some QTE's  I would have to say my fave part of the game so far is probably sneaking around when their are enemy soliders on patrol and you are using your bow to freak them out, the AI is good for that as they actually do get scared and start to search for you and speak about what is happening. During this sale pick up this game.

An excellent mashup of Uncharted's exotic, cinematic adventure and Batman: Arkham's gadget-upgrading progression. This is the reboot that every greying franchise wishes it got. Best game I've played this year.

Absolutely beautiful game all round.  The becoming of Lara croft is a story not to be missed. I have not yet played ny of the rest of the series but have the entire collection in my library. I intend to play them chroologically sohaving this background may just make the rest of the series a complete story. Also i do not hve a very powerful pc but the graphics in this game re absolutely superb. just wish i could crank everything and witness the tress fx beauty.

Liked the game overall, the movement in the environment was solid and fun. Also liked the skill progression. The setting was appropriate and cool.    Didn't like some of the (boss fight related) quick time events. And also the fact that you had a group of allies but in reality you were always alone. This is so jarring after you have played something like Bioshock Infinite what proves that you can have an extremely competent AI with you (for some sections for example) that improves the experience and the story.
The best Tomb Raider out there. The new Lara Croft is fantastic, and the game is one non-stop action ride. The hours just fly by in this game.
Absolutely amazing game! Great graphics, gameplay, storyline. Most of the time I actually felt like I was about to fall off the rock wall lol Played multiplayer. Seems pretty fun so far! 10/10

Amazing gameplay, nice graphs and story, and for a plus, if u play it on 3d(with glasses), u wont want to go back to normal playing XD, is another level of gammin, and this game was made for it, or so it seems.
Great fun to play (who doesn't like firing arrows through some baddies head?) Lovely graphics everyone says its not a tomb raider game, but who cares its brilliant fun to play!!

Awesome game! If you want your girlfriend to start playing a game I'd suggest this one. So she can stop telling you ' You need to pay attention to me.' Also it will give her great motivation to get a firm booty like Laura Croft. :) Oh has an exellent story too!
Decent combat, excellent story, beautiful graphics (and hair)  This is a runner for GOTY. Even if you are not a fan of the franchise, it still deserves a playthrough
This game is really good. I could not stop playing it. Its so good Im considering buying the definitive edition for the PS4.
I Have always loved Tomb Raider and this is the best one yet lots more action ! with all the same puzzles to get through.
Innovative but maintaining the essence of the original saga. Love it.
This is actually quite a good game. While I write this it is on sale for $10. For sure worth it.

Absolutely phenominal. The animations, controls, shooting mechanics, pacing, voice acting, music, platforming are all fantastic.  The biggest strong point of the game is the pacing. While there are side missions like tomb raiding and collecting stuff, the main story keeps its pace making the player feel as if there's something that needs to be done. That's a rarity nowadays where most games have a breather period or lull for side quests reducing the immediacy of the main story. That is thankfully not the case here and has the best of a good television series where each cliffhanger leads to the next feeding that euphoria just enough to still want more.  The game makes excellent use of the Tomb Raider series, the icons of the series are not overplayed and come in at just the right moment to give that 'hell yeah!' feeling.  Each puzzle/combat segment is interlaced with story and cutscenes so that each part never feels like they overstay their welcome. The scripting is incredible every one of the scripted moments feel like a movie.  It's a shame this game didn't sell more copies than it did, it's definitely worth a playthrough.
Gameplay isn't hard but still enjoyable. The story and visuals are very good IMO. I'm looking forward to the sequel. Hoping we'll get to explore larger tombs and more puzzles!
best game ever.very good graffics,very good story and a hell of a gunfire...a MUST game to be played
Get this amazing Reboot you idiots!

Not a bad game by any means, but it has the same problems Uncharted had, as in the character behaves completely different cutscene and gameplay wise, and this doesn't have even half the charm Uncharted and it's story has. gameplay is fine though. Get it on a sale.
A truly brilliant game with beautiful graphics and an addictive story.
best tomb raider ever love this game ! :D <3
Enjoyable story, easy play, good art.

This game is just plain brilliant. I was one of the best games I've ever played. Even though I bought this during a sale there is no doubt I would have payed full price for it because it was worth it. Anyways, It's awesome and I highly recomend it. Very atmospheric, customisable weapons, puzzles to enjoy not fustrate, overall a 10/10.
best game i've played that came out this year  9/10

I am not one to like AAA games, too much graphics, no story, no gameplay etc. Tomb Raider is an exception to all of this. Gameplay was exciting, fun, sometimes frustrating trying to figure out how to pass a difficult spot. The story was fantastic (as for the plot not so much, its a freaking tomb raider and its full of rediculous), what I mean is you really got attached to lara and her friends, you hated the villans/not so nice guys, the character development of lara really helped you hope/fear with her. One of the few games I completed, kept my attention all the way to the end, and I had a blast with the bow and arrow.

This is a very fun game. It reminds me of Uncharted type gameplay on the ps3. You raid some tombs here and there and the game mechanics are fun. (other than the quicktime events sometimes) Solving some platform puzzles and taking out some goons. Also some very gory deaths! Reminds me of the Deadspace death scenes. So if you let Lara die some nasty impalement or crushed by bolder and such may happen. This is a reboot of the fan favortie Tomb Raider and they really pulled it off. The game looks great and plays awesome. I can't wait for the next tomb raider game. Would recommend this any day. Also if this game ever goes on sale. Its a must buy, wont be disapointed, if your into 3rd person platform shooter.
Epic. Fun. I completed it 100% and never really felt bored by searching for useless things. Great story, and just plain fun to play.
Definately one of the best games I have every played, was worth every penny. Tip: Don't bother spending money on the dlc maps, the game never picks them!
Best Tomb Raider since 1998.
Great! :D I'm not a fan of TR series, but this one is really awesome!

Great game. You don't need to have touched the last few Lara Crofts to enjoy this one. or even be a malchauvinistic pig to enjoy it. Though it helps.

This game is Uncharted, but only better. Intense, beautiful and it plays great on the PC. Wether you use a controller, or keyboard and mouse, it plays perfectly. The story is intense and you really want to go on to see it through to the end. Yes, it is getting used to that Lara is more then often crying or yelping, but then she becomes stronger and you actually root for her. If you like adventure, cinematic graphics, puzzles, thrills and exploring, then this is the game for you.
I never cared about Lara until this game. Loved it!

Great game! Lara is immensely realistic; from her voice acting to her animations Square Enix has done a great job of putting this together. The gameplay is fluid, I personally would recommend using a 360 controller, but that’s just me. The visuals aren’t anything too fancy, but Lara still looks great (as always). Where I really think this game shines is the voice acting. Lara’s voice is very convincing, and every other character’s voice is also done well. Overall this is a game that will make you think and will not disappoint.

Pretty good, but it's one of those 'cinematic' games where you 'press X to not die' quite a lot.  Once I began to ignore the lame quick time events, decided to only use the bow instead of guns and never to use the cheat mode (survivor vision) I had quite a bit of fun playing this.  Plots a little strange and a little weak but not terrible.  I'm shipping Lara and Sam for future Tomb Raider games. They'd make a great couple.

Amazing game, a must buy for any fan of the series, as well as anyont looking for a dramatic linear cinematic singleplayer experience akin to games like Uncharted or Hydrophobia!!! Very well optimized considering it's a console port and has very cmooth gamepad controls+^_^+ only issue i had with this game is that even set to the hardest difficulty i felt it was too easy+^_^+

A criminally underrated gem. Unlike much of the gameplay of the Tomb Raider's before it, this installment focuses on exploration, collectables, and an integrated storyline. There's plenty to do, plenty to see, and has a good length that does not overstay it's welcome.   Combat is very similar to the undercharted series, especially for mulltiplayer. Easily the best adventure game I've ever played. Drop dead beautiful too. The opening level is worth letting your friends play to see the power of pc as it will amaze them.  Oh and make sure you have Tress FX on as it turns the game from console to PC next gen.

As of today's summer sale 7.13.13 this is a steal! I think even at full price it still worth your money. This is a very well made action adventure game. There are a lot of intense scene to keep you on your toes (QTE's). The story won't win any awards but because of the pacing, it feels like a good action/adventure movie. There's also a few stealth here and there if you're into that or you can just engage them in an all out gun fight. They even included some small rpg mechanics into the mix. I have never completed any Tomb Raider of the past so I can't compare them but all I can say is I really enjoyed this game and I hope next Tomb Raider will be as good. Best action adventure game I played in a while!

Even if you're not a fan of the original Tomb Raider games, this reboot is amazing. There are a few points that make it a bit 'arcadey' (for example, Lara can regain her health just by hiding behind a rock for a few seconds, and turn a pistol into a sub-machine gun just by collecting bits of salvage), but nevertheless it's still an incredibly enjoyable game that makes you want to come back for 'one more shot' and has a pretty well written story to boot.
This is the first Tomb Raider game I've ever played. As a newcomer to the series, I absolutely loved it. I'm a big fan of the Uncharted series and this gave me a similar vibe.

I was very sceptical of a prequel Tomb Raider game and I'm not entirely sure why. This instalment wastes no time in beating the living hell out of you at every turn. So many ways to die, most of it by nature just waiting for that slip or fall....or the occasional hungry wolf. This is what Tomb Raider needed at some point, was a story around how it all started. It also needed to get away from what was becoming nothing more than a random enter-tomb-puzzle-loot-n-shoot.  Overall I enjoyed playing this quite a bit. The movement and action sequences were fluid, and the world was relatively easy to navigate. There were some expected issues with grappling ledges clipping improperly, causing a very painful and sometimes comical death.
4.2 / 5 --- For those that are fans or want a good experience, solving puzzels, beautiful views, then this is the game for you.

The new Tomb Raider is the gaming equivalent of a good summer blockbuster. You go in to have fun and eat cheesy popcorn, and that's pretty much what you get!   You have it all: adventure, exploration, gratuitous violence, shooting down baddies, a silly plot twist, gorgeous views, spectacular camera shots, some cleavage and let's not forget ... explosions! You'll be the one doing most of the above and you get to play the hero(ine), so all in all, very entertaining!  Don't go in expecting too much drama or depth, don't take anything seriously and just enjoy the ride!
